snippet: A huge throng of people, mostly young, took to Hong Kong’s streets Tuesday, defying Beijing’s dwindling tolerance for challenges to its control.
abstract: Hundreds of thousands of protesters, mostly young, turn out for pro-democracy march in Hong Kong, defying Chinese government's dwindling tolerance for challenges to its control.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER, MICHAEL FORSYTHE and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Jonah Kessel, Hilda Wang and Alan Wong contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A huge throng of people, mostly young, took to Hong Kong’s streets Tuesday, defying Beijing’s dwindling tolerance for challenges to its control.

headline.main: Huge Crowds Turn Out for Pro-Democracy March in Hong Kong, Defying Beijing
headline.print_headline: Huge Crowds Turn Out for Pro-Democracy March in Hong Kong, Defying Beijing
